items.title: Lotus
items.desc: Nelumbo is a genus of aquatic plants with large, showy flowers. Members are commonly called lotus, though lotus is a name also applied to various other plants and plant groups, including the unrelated genus Lotus

items.title: Rose
items.desc: A rose is a woody perennial flowering plant of the genus Rosa, in the family Rosaceae, or the flower it bears. There are over a hundred species and thousands of cultivars.

items.title: Sunflower
items.desc: Helianthus or sunflower L. is a genus of plants comprising about 70 species in the family Asteraceae. The genus is one of many in the Asteraceae that are known as sunflowers.

items.title: Tiger
items.desc: The tiger is the largest cat species, most recognizable for their pattern of dark vertical stripes on reddish-orange fur with a lighter underside. The species is classified in the genus Panthera with the lion, leopard, jaguar, and snow leopard.

items.title: Elephant
items.desc: Elephants are large mammals of the family Elephantidae and the order Proboscidea. Three species are currently recognized: the African bush elephant, the African forest elephant, and the Asian elephant

items.title: Horse
items.desc: The horse is one of two extant subspecies of Equus ferus. It is an odd-toed ungulate mammal belonging to the taxonomic family Equidae.

items.title: Parrot
items.desc: Parrots, also known as psittacines, are birds of the roughly 393 species in 92 genera that make up the order Psittaciformes, found in most tropical and subtropical regions

items.title: Humming Bird
items.desc: Hummingbirds are birds from the Americas that constitute the family Trochilidae. They are among the smallest of birds, most species measuring 7.5â€“13 cm in length.

items.title: Duckling
items.desc: Duck is the common name for a large number of species in the waterfowl family Anatidae, which also includes swans and geese.
